speakers.bio: David has been working in the software dev industry for 30 years and has been building and leading development teams for over 15 of those years, working in companies such as Oracle, Full Tilt Poker and Zalando.  As the need for speed and innovation increases in today's creative economy, David thinks the biggest question facing us today, is how we create great work environments where people are motivated and committed to solving today's complex problems. And love doing so. To aid in this goal, David is currently doing an Masters in Work and Organisational Behaviour in DCU with specific interests and research in the areas of self-determination theory, team autonomy, employee motivation, commitment and engagement in a hi-tech organisation

profile_picture.description: David Zalando, Head of Engineering, Zalando

speakers.bio: Tuomas is a UX Designer at Yousician. Software has been one of his biggest passions since 1988, from MS-DOS to Android Oreo. Two degrees in computer science and an ICT career spanning 20 years have given him a solid understanding of good UX. It was the usability studies conducted at Aalto School of Arts that revolutionized his way of creating the best user-centered products and services. At Yousician, he gets to deploy these skills in the very best environment, helping enable the company's mission to make musicality as common as literacy.

Noe Falzon is the Scrum Master in Yousician's Engagement team. Despite graduating in telecom engineering and taking his first steps in the world of network security, he soon pivoted to a subject he was more passionate about: video games. After being a game programmer in renowned studios Rovio and Remedy, he combined his skill set with his second passion, music, by joining the Yousician family. Now a certified Scrum Master, he oversees the processes in his team and ensures that focus is held on their continuous improvement.

session.name: Ensuring an effective prototyping process that aligns with all objectives to speed to delivery
Being DevOps in Desktop Software Development
Strategy Definition and Implementation for Successful Product Launch

speakers.bio: As the Lead Principal Software Engineer in ASOS Technology, Nik Crabtree is responsible for Software and QA Engineering, UI Engineering and Data Engineering across the organisation. His role has a simple brief: come in every day with one aim - make engineering and engineers at ASOS better. Nik joined ASOS in March 2015 after six years at Avanade where he lead the Cloud & Integration Practice. Nik worked on both Azure and on-premises solutions with customers such as Skype, Blinkbox, Barclays, Best Buy and ASOS.

session.name: Growth = product ( design x engineering) ^ marketing

speakers.bio:
Passionate about disruptive innovation, technology and building great companies. Val's work has been featured in national and international publications including New York Times, Forbes & TechCrunch.
